current.about: Margot Lévêque is a French Graphic and Type Designer currently based in Paris. She specialized in Type Design, Branding, Web & Editorial Design. After gaining experiences in Paris and Amsterdam, she spent a few months working at Pentagram in New-York with Paula Scher. She's currently an independent graphic designer working with clients like Hermès Paris, Vogue, Louis Vuitton, &Walsh, Studio Nari, etc. across the fields of fashion, music, art and more.

settings.title: Vogue
settings.text: Bespoke typeface designed for Vogue Singapore inspired by the Vanda orchid and the ancient language of Sanskrit. Created in collaboration with Studio Nari.

settings.title: Ariana Grande
settings.text: Titles + credits for Ariana Grande’s remix of 34+35 (feat. Doja Cat and Megan Thee Stallion). Designed with ABC Marya, an incoming font designed with Dinamo's type foundry.

settings.title: Type 01
settings.text: Custom /4 designed for Type 01 Magazine. Picture by Lili Phillips

settings.title: Georgie Yana
settings.text: Custom logotype & monogram designed for 3D designer Georgie Yana
settings.text_mobile: Custom logotype & monogram designed for 3D designer Georgie Yana

settings.title: &Walsh
settings.text: Additional ampersands designed for &Walsh. 50 final ampersands have been drawn in their style and will draw a custom ampersand drawn for every new project or team member. The ampersand is one of the most beautiful typographic characters and will challenge ourselves to continuously reinvent its form. {andwalshdotcom}

settings.title: Phoebe Tonkin
settings.text: Custom logotype for Phoebe Tonkin. LESJOUR! (pronounced leisure), is a new way of thinking about dressing, inspired by the leisure suits of the ‘70s—a wardrobe staple that’s as versatile as it is chic. Each piece is handmade in LA.

settings.title: Modular
settings.text: @modularbymensah is a sculptural furniture designer based in London. We created Modular to represent this ethos, exploring how a typeface can take on human forms, whilst also feeling modular at its core. Modular has bespoke glyphs for specific characters that allow the characters to adapt depending on the space they are trying to fill. Created in collaboration with Studio Nari.

settings.title: Threads of fate
settings.text: Aura is a bespoke typeface created for Threads of Fate. An oracle and tarot deck producer in Los Angeles. The typeface was created to hold symbols in the counters of the characters as well as have hidden graphic motifs embedded in the character builds. Soft and sharp shapes juxtapose to create a sense of movement and elegance within each character. {more}
settings.text_mobile: Bespoke font designed for Threads of Fate

settings.title: COLOPHON
settings.content:
Design: Margot Lévêque

Development: New Territory Studio

©all rights reserved

settings.about:
Margot Lévêque is a French Type Designer and Type Strategist currently based in New York. She has a solid knowledge in the typography field and helps brands create unique typography with a honed design aesthetic. This process includes a custom logo, bespoke typefaces and type design advisements.


After graduating from a design school in Paris with an Art Direction and Type Designer Master’s Degree, Margot went on to work with prestigious agencies and fashion labels including Vogue, Louis Vuitton, Pentagram, Prada, A24, &Walsh and Hermès Paris, and work closely with famous clients such as Phoebe Tonkin, Ariana Grande and Emma Chamberlain. 


Elegance, creativity, invention & beauty: That’s how Margot Leveque defines her process. She is working worldwide mainly with fashion, skincare, art, hotel and music brands and also offers creative consultancy, working closely with people to elevate their own brands.

Inquiries, freelance work

studio@margotleveque.com

¶

By paying, downloading, installing and/or using Digital Fonts, you confirm that you have read and accepted the terms of this agreement whose terms bind you legally to Margot Lévêque and that you have the legal capacity to contract.

Should you not accept the conditions above and below, do not purchase, access, download and/or install or otherwise use the Digital Font.

The trial is free and complete- allows you to use our trial fonts to decide if you want to buy a license

settings.title: LICENSES - RULES
settings.content:
The company size of the client is the only metric you need to know in order to license fonts. You don’t have to gather any information about their web traffic, app downloads, etc.

Each license includes unlimited uses for Print, Websites, Mobile applications, Global Corporate, Electronic publications, Social networks, Videos and Movies.

Our fonts are priced based on the company size of the font’s license owner, not on the number of people working with the font files. Your or your client’s company size is the only number you need to calculate the price for our licenses. No information about web traffic or app downloads is necessary.

You are required to upgrade your license only if the company significantly changes its size and the use of the fonts increases beyond the agreed uses.


S → 1-3 People/Company

M → 4-10 People/Company

L → 11-35 People/Company

XL → 36-70 People/Company

More? Contact us : studio@margotleveque.com

Margot Lévêque Studio cannot be held responsible for damage caused or supported by the end user and/or third party resulting from a misuse of the Digital Font. settings.content:
All prices from www.margotleveque.com are in USD and free of taxes. All prices are subject to change without prior notice.

This website offer various payment options : Paypal, CB, MasterCard, Visa.

For a payment by wire transfer, users are invited to contact us for more information by email at: lvq.margot@gmail.com. The download link will only be available once the payment has been processed.

The advertised price must be paid in full after the order confirmation. Data recorded by Margot Lévêque be evidence of all transactions between you and Margot Lévêque.

settings.title: ORDERS
settings.content:
The user commits himself to providing complete, correct and honest information during order process on our website.

The order confirmation of one of our products, counts as the commitment is firm and definitive.

After checkout user will receive by email a download link. The typefaces are delivered in .OTF, .WOFF and .WOFF2.

settings.title: REFUNDS
settings.content:
When the file delivery corresponds to the order made, we are not able to offer a refund once an order has been completed. We may substitute a corrupted or a wrong file.

According to the French act signed on 1997, May 20th: the client can not get a refund for the purchase of downloadable products (Fonts) on the Internet.

settings.title: Romie Italic
settings.description:
Romie is a typeface designed by Margot Lévêque. Started in 2017, this typeface is a display born from calligraphy. It covers a majority of the european languages and comes in the standard file formats (for print & web). Romie has been updated in 2022: the glyphset has been expanded, including its mythical large ligatures set. Romie is now available in Regular, Regular Italic, Medium, Bold and Black. The others italics will be released very soon!

Many thanks to Guillaume Besson for his help in development, production and for all the support during the release rush! Special + Another special thanks to Céline Hurka for her help in development.
settings.license:

settings.title: Romie Regular
settings.description: Romie is a calligraphy-inspired display font designed by Margot Lévêque and updated in 2022 with expanded glyphs and a mythical ligatures set. It supports European languages and is available in five weights - Regular, Regular Italic, Medium, Bold, and Black - with more italic styles to come. Guillaume Besson and Céline Hurka contributed to its development and production.
settings.license:
LICENSES ALL-IN-ONE

→ Each license includes Unlimited uses for Print, Websites, Mobile applications, Global Corporate, Electronic publications, Social networks, Videos and Movies.

→ Your or your client's company size is the only number you need to calculate the price for our licenses.

settings.title: Kalice Regular
settings.description:
Kalice is a display font that was originally designed by Margot Lévêque in 2018 and updated in 2023 with the release of the italic style. Expertly mastered and produced by Guillaume Besson.

Kalice is a revival of the Elzévir Anglais typeface from the Turlot Foundry. This font features clean lines and a sleek, modern aesthetic, making it ideal for use in headlines, logos, and other graphic design projects. With support for a wide range of European languages, Kalice is a versatile addition to any design toolkit. Both the regular weight and the newly released italic style come in standard file formats.
settings.license:
LICENSES ALL-IN-ONE

→ Each license includes Unlimited uses for Print, Websites, Mobile applications, Global Corporate, Electronic publications, Social networks, Videos and Movies.

→ Your or your client's company size is the only number you need to calculate the price for our licenses.

settings.title: Ninna Display
settings.description: Ninna is a Roman display font that blends historical forms with contemporary design. It features a set of classical characters and beautifully ornate swash alternates, each one inspired by the Decorative Arts. Designed by Margot Lévêque and expertly produced and developed with the help of Fanny Hamelin, Ninna was created between 2019 and 2022. This font is available in one weight and style.

settings.title: ABC Marya
settings.description: Marya is a typeface designed by Margot. In 2020, Dinamo proposed a collaboration in order to have Marya in their catalog. Marya has been completely reworked and optimized by Margot alongside Dinamo. This typeface covering a majority of the european languages, it comes in the standard file formats.
